project.teaser: The SYMBA project aims at creating a new and innovative IS method to be replicated within EU according to the local/regional bio-based industrial ecosystem. SYMBA will implement a user-friendly and accessible AI database suggesting regional IS innovative processes to create...
project.objective: The SYMBA project aims at creating a new and innovative IS method to be replicated within EU according to the local/regional bio-based industrial ecosystem. SYMBA will implement a user-friendly and accessible AI database suggesting regional IS innovative processes to create zero-waste value chains, ensuring more local supply chains; a better distribution of economic and social benefits among the stakeholders and an increase in the economic value of final products. SYMBA solution, aligned with the EU Bioeconomy Strategy, is based on a threefold approach: 1) Creation and validation of new IS methodology for the bio-based sector, starting from existing knowledge and lessons earned from SYMBA consortium partners. 2) Individuation of criteria to select regional hubs 3) AI database including Monitoring tools, waste relation matrix, networking and cooperation with ongoing EU and local networks. The partnership has been intentionally selected by its expertise, network with key external stakeholders and geographical reach, bringing together 5 EU countries (IT, ES, BE, NL, DE) to consolidate the maximum outreach of the initiative. It consists of 9 partners with complementary competences: 4 RTD centers (CIRCE, CTB, AIMPLAS; CET); 1 large industry (NVMT); 1 pilot facility (BBEPP); 1 innovative SME (ENCO) and 2 networks (CKIC and ICLEI) with a valuable background in applying IS approach in the bio-based sector, providing services to companies and creating awareness and networking among citizens, policy makers, EU initiatives. Through the involvement of different industrial sectors: agri-food (NVMT); packaging (AIMPLAS); wastewater (CET); textile (CTB); waste valorisation (BBEPP), SYMBA will demonstrate how to shift from a linear to a circular economy contributing to deliver bio-based solutions with reduced environmental impacts on soil, water and air quality.
project.title: Securing local supplY chains via the development of new Methods to assess the circularity and symbiosis of the Bio-bAsed industrial ecosystem enhancing the EU competitiveness and resource independence

article.title: A transformative shift from a linear to a circular bio-based economy

result.title: 1st Report on summary of New European Bauhaus activities
result.description: D6.3 includes a 1st draft report with summary of the networking activities carried with the New European Bauhaus Community. It also includes the outcomes of 4 virtual meetings to share NEB updates, opportunities, events and guidance; 3 trainings/webinar sessions on awareness and NEB; and 3 sessions of NEB coaching to SYMBA.D6.3 will include results of T6.3 Interactive collaborations with New European Bauhaus communities.

result.title: Policy brief 1 (M18)
result.description: D5.4 includes a summary with suggestions and activities to support policy makers in implementing Industrial Symbiosis approaches (e.g. analysis of teh challenges and opportunities, policy options and preliminary recommendations). D5.4 will include the results of T5.3 Policy integration into local strategies.

result.title: SYMBA Business Model
result.description: "This deliverable will include 4 ""Packages leaflets"" about 4 Business Models (BM) (in English and all partners' languages) to support the replicability of SYMBA project results (business cases). D8.3 will include results of T8.3 Replicability and Business Models ."

result.title: 1st Report on summary of Hubs for Circularity community activities
result.description: D6.2 includes a first report with the summary of all the activities carried out with the Hubs for Circularity community such as 4 virtual meetings with the H4C community, 4 trainings/webinar sessions on awareness and synergies, and 3 webinars between H4C and SYMBA partners. D6.2 will include results of T6.2 Interactive collaboration with Hubs4Circularity ECoP consortium and other existing initiatives.

result.title: Report on current Industrial Symbiosis solutions in Europe
result.description: D3.1 consists of a Report including all existing Industrial Symbiosis solutions in Europe. The report includes analysis of the current knowledge in terms of approaches, methodologies, digital platforms that foster and enable IS at EU level. It also reports on the outcomes of the data collection related to key indicative resources (e.g. water, energy, metals, plastics, biological feedstocks, textiles, etc...).D3.1 will include results of T3.1 Data collection on Industrial Symbiosis solutions.

result.title: Evaluation of Industrial Symbiosis prioritized solutions
result.description: D3.3 includes a report with an evaluation of all the Industrial Symbiosis prioritized solutions. It presents the outcomes of a multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) as well as a database and a set of guidelines for the IS implementation.D3.3 will include results of T3.3 Evaluation of industrial symbiosis prioritized solutions.

result.title: Open Sciences and Data Management Plan
result.description: D1.2 consists of a document outlining how data will be collected, generated and handled during the project execution. D1.2 will include results of T1.3 Responsible Data Management.

result.title: Report on system mapping and SYMBA forum activities.
result.description: D6.1 consists of a report summarizing the SYMBA forum and cross-exchange activities with ongoing EU projects and initiatives such as elaboration of a collaborative strategy, organization of 2 interactive workshops. D6.1 will include results of T6.1 SYMBA forum and cross-exchange with ongoing EU funded projects.

result.title: List and analysis of prioritized Industrial Symbiosis solutions
result.description: D3.2 consists of a report including the list and analysis of Industrial Symbiosis prioritized solutions during SYMBA. Stakeholders from 5 critical bio-based sectors/value chains will be considered: agri-food; plastic and packaging; textile; waste and wastewater valorisation.D3.2 will include results of T3.2 Internal co-creation and weighting.

result.title: Promotional materials, brand identity & Project website
result.description: D8.2 includes a set of promotional materials (e.g. poster, brochures, flyers, roll-up), project brand identity and project website to be made available online. D8.2 will include results of T8.2 Communication & Dissemination Implementation 1st phase.

category.title: wastewater treatment processes
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/water treatment processes/wastewater treatment processes

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
